Action thriller, starring Tom Benedict Knight and Simon Phillips

Horror filmed entirely from the murderer's point of view, starring Elijah Wood and Nora Arnezeder

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: June Ackland puts her professionalism on the line to protect a woman from her violent husband , while Sheelagh Murphy tells Des Taviner that they're through, only for passion to get the better of the pair. Meanwhile, a drug dealer tells the Sun Hill officers about a long-standing arrangement he had with Nick Klein _ prompting Adam Okaro to visit the disgraced cop in rehab

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The threat of disciplinary action hangs over June Ackland when her professional conduct comes under scrutiny following the tragedy at her home, while Cameron Tait gets a nasty surprise when he bumps into an old flame during an investigation into a robbery. Tony Stamp and Reg Hollis get more than they bargained for when they offer to help an elderly couple on their way to a wedding

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Cameron Tait is pushed too far when he discovers his daughter has been left home alone, and as Phil Hunter continues his efforts to prove Mark is responsible for the robbery, Cameron snatches the youngster and disappears into the wide blue yonder. June Ackland tries to get used to life in uniform again, and it's not long before she's back in the thick of things when a violent stabbing takes place

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An increasingly desperate Cameron Tait decides the only way to ensure his daughter's safety is to flee back to Australia. Mickey Webb brings a glamorous woman in for questioning after a man is found seriously injured in her hallway, only for Jack Meadows to fall for the suspect's charms. Phil Hunter gets on the wrong side of his wife when she thinks he's being unfaithful again

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Polly Page is less than pleased when her hated cousin Michelle turns up asking her to track down a stalker, and Jack Meadows vows to help sexy suspect Rachel Heath _ although her future is looking decidedly bleak. On the streets of Sun Hill, June Ackland resolves to find the relatives of an elderly woman attacked by muggers. Linda Robson and Lysette Anthony guest star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Valerie helps mother of five Betty come to terms with her sixth child's birth defect. The Turners oversee a measles vaccination trial at the clinic, but are concerned by an overly anxious first-time mother. They soon discover she is concealing a devastating loss, which could have serious repercussions. Nurse Crane decides to bring a taste of the seaside to Poplar for the Whitsun bank holiday, and Violet's political career goes from strength to strength as she wins the seat on the council for Poplar North

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson goes to desperate lengths to make Miss Havisham notice him, and Martha Cratchit's wedding plans are thrown into turmoil by an unexpected knock at the door. Omid Djalili, Christopher Fairbank, Anton Lesser and Caroline Quentin feature alongside Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton and Phoebe Dynevor in this period drama, re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Bob Cratchit fights to clear his name to enable him to return home in time for his daughter's wedding, however the evidence is stacked up against him. Meanwhile, Compeyson's behaviour leaves Amelia feeling confused but intrigued. Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili star in this period drama, which re-imagines the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales, set in a fictional version of 19th century London

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Dwelling Place
programme.desc: Feature-length adaptation of the best-selling novel, telling the tale of a 16-year-old struggling to keep her five brothers and sisters out of the workhouse with the help of a kindly carpenter. Starring James Fox, Tracy Whitwell and Edward Rawle-Hicks

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates a deadly magical mishap at the local talent show

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies stars in a feature-length episode of the offbeat crime drama. Master of illusion Jonathan is called upon to solve several disappearances inside the gloomy attic of a vast Gothic house, but is completely baffled by the mystery, which for 70 years has been attributed to the ghost of a madman said to prey upon human flesh. When two women shelter from a thunderstorm there one night, the ominous presence claims another victim, leaving her friend - Joey Ross - determined to get to the truth of what happened. Jonathan finds himself working alongside Joey, and it seems his formidable powers of deduction are in danger of being eclipsed by her raw intuition. With Sheridan Smith as Joey

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. Miles and Chandler's latest case takes them deep into the world of modern art after the discovery of a flayed human face at Whitechapel Gallery. Interpreting some Russian prison tattoos suggests a link to organised crime, but what is the significance of the mysterious footsteps heard in empty corridors at the police station? As the investigation progresses, the killer strikes again, leaving a coded message, and Buchan's desperate search for answers leads him on a dangerous path. Starring Phil Davis, Rupert Penry-Jones, and Steve Pemberton, who also wrote this episode

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. As the killer runs rings around the team, striking quickly and leaving coded messages at the crime scenes, Chandler and Miles start to question the motives behind the gruesome deeds. The investigation is then further hampered when a new eyewitness claims the murderer looks like an old lady, and as the body count rises, Buchan works hard to find a precedent - but his research looks set to put him in danger

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Part two of two. With Luther dogged by ghosts from his past, a cold case might be the key to unlocking a mystery that's tormenting him. Meanwhile, with the cannibalistic serial killer still at large, Benny's hacking skills have revealed a list of hundreds of potential victims. Realising it's all part of a macabre end game, the detective is forced to put himself and new colleague Emma into the heart of danger to try and stop the killer. Drama, starring Idris Elba, Laura Haddock and Rose Leslie

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: With time running out on her deception, Roz phones Father Michael from work, ahead of a devastating and public confrontation with her boss. Given a grace period of 24 hours before she must face the police, Roz uses the time to make vital preparations for her family, while Father Michael has a moment of clarity and makes a decision which goes against his vows - but might just save a life. Elsewhere, Helen leads the community in a vigil outside the police station, as PC Andrew Powell struggles to make peace with what he has done.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Reeling from the death of his friend, Luther races to save the others from Cornelius' terrible retribution. With Luther's increasing absence from the case, Halliday helms the hunt for a killer on the loose - a killer determined to complete his final macabre masterpiece. Thriller, starring Idris Elba

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe and PC Guthrie go back to school to investigate the possession of Ecstasy tablets and the beating of a police chief's son, and it is not long before Freddy Fisher finds himself under close scrutiny. Richard Griffiths stars

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A dawn raid by bailiffs leaves the antiques dealer staring ruin in the face, and with nothing left to look forward to, he decides to turn his back on society. With Ian McShane and guest star Alexei Sayle

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Malick's old flame Paul turns up at the hospital after an accident with his family, and reveals he is seriously ill, prompting the hot-headed medic to recommend a risky course of treatment. Meanwhile, the return of a familiar face causes Chrissie to doubt her relationship with Dan, and Jac takes desperate action to keep baby Freya, but ends up reconsidering after an encounter with an overweight patient

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Megan is unable to save Ewart when he suffers a second heart attack. Patty Freeman is brought into Casualty suffering from septic shock

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A distraught Mickey Webb sets his sights on vengeance, vowing to track down the mugger responsible for his mother's death, while Juliet Becker tries to trap a drug dealer. Honey Harman's fiance lands in a spot of bother when Eva Sharpe and Phil Hunter are called to the football club where he plays, forcing the kooky PC to decide where her loyalties lie

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Can Dennis deal with his actions? Garry's determined to prove himself to Lynne. Laura worries for her baby's health

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Laura doubts that Garry's the father after all. Sharon's gift to Dennis leaves him feeling uncomfortable

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: First episode of the period drama following the fortunes of two sisters who open a fashion house in 1920s London after the death of their father leaves them virtually penniless. Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard star

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. An American acquaintance of Lovejoy's is sold some fake antiques, so he sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible - and make a little money into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Carol is thrilled by a surprise visit from her son, but it soon becomes apparent he's living a secret life _ and Joanna is determined to find out the truth. Meanwhile, Sam and Kerri expose a drugs fraud and Andrew makes a life-changing decision. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Joseph Millson

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: A misguided attempt to injure the gardener at Bayview lands Diana in hospital with a broken hip and it looks like she might miss her niece's wedding. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry becomes dejected when his fitness-mad neighbour Boothroyd begins to outshine him in all things physical. However, he discovers that when it comes to karate, he may just have an advantage over his new rival. Long-running comedy, guest starring Brian Conley

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Howard becomes ill at ease with his lot in life, and tries to change his appearance so that not even Pearl would recognise him. But he soon discovers that the drawbacks of assuming someone else's identity are greater than the benefits

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Mod inspires Davies to undergo assertiveness training after his colleagues subject him to another humiliating practical joke and even Julie is impressed when he turns up demanding visiting rights to their dog. Meanwhile, the death of one medical researcher and the disappearance of a second under mysterious circumstances reveal the stakes are high in the pharmaceutical world when a drug to treat Alzheimer's disease is rumoured to be nearing the end of clinical trials. Drama, starring Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the kidnapping of two boys in 1979, which they believe could be linked to a recent spate of disappearances. The youngsters involved in the earlier case escaped - though their abductor was never found. Fearing they may be on the trail of a serial killer, the detectives also uncover a link with another unsolved case - the assault on a champion fisherman

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A Home Office pathologist joins the team to help discover the identity of a dead girl found in woodland in 1987. The detectives trace her origins back to the Highlands of Scotland, uncovering evidence of syphilis and a possible connection with local aristocrat Lady Deeley. Meanwhile, Lane confronts his fears by revisiting the crime scene. Detective drama, guest starring Timothy West and Jane Asher

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. An armed police raid at a terraced house in North London sees two suspected terrorists killed, along with a police officer. Nikki doubts the officers' accounts of events after carrying out the post mortems as the forensic evidence just doesn't add up. The case then takes an unexpected turn when it transpires one of the surviving policemen is having an affair with his dead colleague's wife

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Malick's old flame Paul turns up at the hospital after an accident with his family, and reveals he is seriously ill, prompting the hot-headed medic to recommend a risky course of treatment. Meanwhile, the return of a familiar face causes Chrissie to doubt her relationship with Dan, and Jac takes desperate action to keep baby Freya, but ends up reconsidering after an encounter with an overweight patient

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey argues with Darryl about the lack of trust in their relationship, and visits a therapist for advice on how to resolve the issue. Comedy, starring Linda Robson

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: As the crucial final match approaches, Fisher asks Crabbe to keep an eye on the police football ground and look after an ex-professional player with a murky past - but there may be more to his new protege than meets the eye. Richard Griffiths stars

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. However, Lady Jane also bids and after discovering the ruse concocts a plan to get her own back and wipe the smile off Lovejoy's face. Charlotte Cornwell guest stars with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Malick blames himself when Paul's brother dies, but the ordeal is not yet over, and the volatile medic is left anxiously waiting to see whether his ex-lover can recover from kidney failure. Meanwhile, an encounter with a happily married couple prompts Chrissie to contemplate her relationship with Dan again, and Jac takes out her frustration on newcomer Kip Maxwell after losing baby Freya. Guest starring Maureen Lipman

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Valerie arranges for the hospital to hold a service for Ewart. A school minibus collides with a car turning what had previously been a quiet night in Casualty into a frantic one

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary Best has no choice but to arrest Gina Gold after a breathalyser test proves positive, leaving his belligerent boss facing serious trouble. Honey Harman also finds herself in a tricky situation - thanks to no-good boyfriend Fletch. Polly Page is shocked when Owen Preston's nephew turns up, wanting to know what happened to his uncle

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat's furious about Garry's neglect of Lynne as Garry attends to Bobby and Laura. Can Laura reveal the truth?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kelly gives Martin an 18th birthday party to remember. Dennis feels he is being watched - are the police still on his trail? Joanne shows Phil the full extent of her feelings

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice finds work and Evangeline sets out to find her dead father's mistress, while Jack decides it is time the girls let their hair down and sweeps them off to a glamorous party. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lovejoy sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible for deceiving his American acquaintance - and make a little money for himself into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna discovers a patient's seemingly trivial snoring problem hides a deep-seated problem requiring sensitive handling. Andrew grabs every opportunity to continue his affair with Kate, and the unexpected reappearance of a childhood sweetheart forces Sam to confront his feelings for Kerri. Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and John McCardle star

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Diana tries her hand at being nice for a 'glamorous granny' competition at Bayview. Stephanie Cole stars

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Local PCs Cooper and Walsh try to master a new crime-fighting technique. However, the duo's carefully laid plans unravel when Barry decides to treat a retired vicar to a day trip. Long-running sitcom, starring Ken Kitson and Louis Emerick

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The women of the village are impressed by a series of fanciful tales told by a retired jewel thief about his larcenous exploits in the south of France. However, the scoundrel's skills are put to the test when Marina and Miss Davenport seek his aid in helping Auntie Wainwright crack a keyless safe. John Challis guest stars

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The duo are called out to a private zoo, where human remains have been found in the tigers' den. The evidence points to an unfortunate accident, but Dalziel suspects foul play - and a connection to a mysterious disappearance he investigated 20 years previously. Detective drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A car in which a teacher was murdered five years earlier is returned to its owner - the victim's husband. Pullman reopens the unsolved case, hoping to track down the dead woman's secret lover, who is known to have had a small tattoo - a clue that eventually leads to a male prostitute. Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of a member of the Jewish Hasidic community is discovered, and the team agrees to perform a 'dry' post mortem to respect the wishes of his faith. A forensic link is found to a group of Polish labourers, but Harry begins to wonder whether the victim's wife is hiding something, and decides to carry out a full autopsy to determine the time of death

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Diana tries her hand at being nice for a 'glamorous granny' competition at Bayview. Stephanie Cole stars

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, featuring fourth-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles. There were mixed fortunes for British players on day seven last year, as Heather Watson lost 6-2, 6-4 to Germany's Jule Niemeier, but Cameron Norrie's excellent run continued when he prevailed in straight sets against America's Tommy Paul. Also on this day, Carlos Alcaraz's tournament came to an end when the Spaniard lost to Jannik Sinner of Italy in four sets

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles. Novak Djokovic's recent dominance of the event continued at this stage last year when he dropped a set to wildcard Tim van Rijthoven but was otherwise very comfortable in a 6-2, 4-6, 6-1, 6-2 victory

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith are in Spalding, South Lincolnshire - the historic hub of Britain's bulb and flower farming industry, to explore its rich heritage. The pair discover how the the current generation of farmers are shaping the future of the flower industry and find out about the economic changes growers have faced. Charlotte meets James Lacey who explains how sunflowers are produced, picked and packed at his family farm and his love of high-tech harvesting. Joe joins young grower Hannah Benson as she delivers hand-cut blooms to sell at the UK's oldest flower auction. Tom Heap reveals how a study using flower chemicals in feed could reduce livestock methane emissions, and Adam Henson discovers how planting trees within arable fields can revolutionise a small farm's income

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Newby Hall & Gardens in Ripon, North Yorkshire. Treasures include an intriguing letter from Lord Nelson, politely replying to his optician just weeks before the Battle of Trafalgar. There's also a piece of the set from Live Aid in 1985, rescued from a skip, and an engagement ring picked up in a pawn shop. The Bradford Museum also launches an appeal to find the families related to the thousands of people in photos in their archive

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

Two former champions won in straight sets on Centre Court at this stage last year, with Simona Halep comfortably prevailing 6-1, 6-2 against fourth seed Paula Badosa, before Rafael Nadal won 6-4, 6-2, 7-6 against Botic van de Zandschulp

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Bangor in Co Down to help Mandy McCreight, who is isolated in her bedroom due to a variety of medical issues and is missing out on family life. Her children Ben and Kara also have mobility problems, while husband Davey looks after everyone, but now he is suffering from a back injury. The entire family are under real stress and the house is not wheelchair friendly, making the situation unbearable

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Freddy and Baba flee the city in search of an isolated spot to bury the witness to their murderous night in the woods. In London, Lola and Jackson are working their way through Matt Bowers's address book. When they find Freddy in London, they take the opportunity to question her again. Guest starring Kris Marshall

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade hosts an extended episode with panellists rail union leader Mick Lynch and actress and comedian Roisin Conaty joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A solo climber risks his life when things go wrong on remote snowy peak, and a dog walk in idyllic rural countryside threatens one woman's life when she's trampled by cows

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Following the death of their mother in childbirth, the residents of Wolf Wood now face losing their father, who has signs of a urinary infection. Thorn the giraffe is trained so he can receive a giant pedicure, zoologist Megan McCubbin serves up some ice lollies to the donkeys to keep them cool and Ben Fogle creates a scent trail for one of his favourite animals, the tapir

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh track the developments of two homes and a piece of land in Suffolk, Nottinghamshire and Kent, all bought from online auctions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Wrexham and discovers the story behind a famous painting. Experts Roo Irvine and Philip Serrell assist the teams in finding bargains

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, featuring the opening men's and ladies's quarter finals. There was nearly an upset on Centre Court at this stage last year, when reigning champion Novak Djokovic lost the opening two sets of his match against Italy's Jannik Sinner, but the Serbian eventually discovered his best form and bounced back to prevail 5-7, 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-2. Meanwhile, Tatjana Maria defeated German compatriot Jule Niemeier 4-6, 6-2, 7-5 on the No. 1 Court

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu prepare to introduce Albie to Peggy and Stacey goes on a date with Theo despite Martin's disapproval. Kim's return to work doesn't go as well as she had hoped and Bobby executes his plan to infiltrate Rocky's stag night

programme.title: Brave Britain with Fergal Keane
programme.desc: Award-winning reporter Fergal Keane goes in search of hope in today's Britain, turning to those in hard-pressed communities and hearing stories of everyday courage. From Glasgow shipyard workers to Leeds council estate residents to tenant farmers in Cornwall, Fergal shines light on the unheard voices of courage across the country

programme.title: Joe Swash: Teens in Care
programme.desc: Joe Swash reveals the harsh reality of what it's like growing up in the care system, spending time with teenagers who are all at crucial stages of their life. Joe's mum Kiffy has been a foster carer for over 15 years and he wants to spend time with teens across the UK who live in foster care, in residential children's homes, and some who have left at 18 and are trying to make it alone, to show what growing up as a teenager in care is really like

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Journalist Hazel Martin investigates the death of Annie Borjesson, a Swedish woman who was found dead on Prestwick Beach. Within hours of her body being found her family were told it was suicide, but they believe the evidence points to murder

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Hazel Martin pieces together the mysterious final hours before Annie Borjesson was found dead and hears an extraordinary theory that her death was a state sponsored hit-job

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Just as Sam and Jay are set to host a friend's wedding that could get their bed-and-breakfast business off the ground, the ghost of Hetty's husband tries to ruin it

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sasappis offers to help Sam complete the B&B website so they can start taking reservations, while Pete bonds with Jay over basketball, until Jay makes a new living friend

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Arit Anderson, Toby Buckland and Adam Frost reveal the latest in floral fashions and share highlights of the show gardens and floral marquee. These include co-presenter Carol Klein's own creation, which has taken her three months to complete

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Margherita Taylor travel to the village of Charsfield in Suffolk to celebrate acclaimed rural writer Ronald Blythe, who died in January aged 100. They visit key locations of his work and explore traditional crafts. Margherita talks to nature writer Melissa Harrison, who was inspired to move to the region by Blythe's works, and John meets a proud Suffolk speaker who explains how the dialect evolved

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and head gardener Scott Smith tackle some of the topical queries they have received from viewers. Carole is also back in the Garden for Wildlife to plant species that suit sunny conditions and also give nature a helping hand, while there is another report on this summer's project of creating a garden for a new-build home

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Alys Fowler shows how to stock up vegetables for the colder months of the year as she grows courgettes, squashes, kale and Jerusalem artichokes. She also learns how to preserve food by using easy pickling recipes, forages for seeds and plants winter crops to keep her going until the next spring

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to get under way in the men's and ladies' singles. 'Middle Sunday' was traditionally a rest day, but it was decided last year to introduce a full schedule to prevent the schedule becoming congested in the event of any weather-related delays. The crowd on the No. 2 Court were treated to a five-set epic, with David Goffin eventually prevailing against Frances Tiafoe. Meanwhile, 2017 French Open champion Jelena Ostapenko's tournament came to an end when she was beaten 5-7, 7-5, 7-5 by Tatjana Maria on the No. 1 Court

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present further live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to conclude in the men's and ladies' singles

programme.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel (2015)
programme.desc: With the original Best Exotic Marigold Hotel a roaring success, owner Sonny decides the time is right to expand his business empire. But to do so, he and the rest of the residents must pull out all the stops to impress a potential investor's inspector - a task that proves to be easier said than done. Comedy drama sequel, with Dev Patel, Maggie Smith, Judi Dench and Richard Gere

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: More live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to conclude in the men's and ladies' singles. Ons Jabeur was the last player on the No. 1 Court to book her place in the quarter-finals last year when she overcame Elise Mertens 7-6, 6-4

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the seventh day's play at the All England Club, featuring matches in the fourth round, as a full schedule of play was expected to take place on 'Middle Sunday' for only the second time in the history of the prestigious tournament

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: Romesh heads to more countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. In this first edition, he heads to Zimbabwe in the aftermath of Robert Mugabe's rule, to discover whether British people should be holidaying in the southern African country once again. He meets Chipo, a teacher who was born and raised in Harare under Mugabe's rule. She explains that although people have been coming to the country, few venture beyond Victoria Falls. She wants to show Rom what they are missing on a grand, epic road trip that takes in National Parks and close-up encounters with rhinos, elephants and the so-called 'cheetah ambassador'

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fourth day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. England have won their last four Tests at this venue, including a one-wicket triumph over the Aussies in 2019

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: After renting for many years in London, actress Jill Halfpenny and her 13-year-old son Harvey made the big decision to start a new life in the North East, where Jill was brought up. They both love the sea views of their new home in Tynemouth, but the flat's layout is revealing its glitches. The kitchen is right at the back of the property, making it feel dark and disconnected, the bathroom has no windows and the only outside space is a tiny balcony. Using virtual reality techniques, architects Will Foster and Lynsey Elliot compete to remodel the property

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents topical debate from Fleetwood, Lancashire. The panel includes Minister for Veterans' Affairs Johnny Mercer MP, Shadow Secretary of State for Education Bridget Phillipson MP, the Economics Editor at the Spectator magazine Kate Andrews and the entrepreneur and Just Stop Oil supporter Dale Vince

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: In South Africa, once a byword for racial segregation under the apartheid regime, Afua Hirsch finds a country in transition with a new creativity emerging from the roots up in the townships, as the once-oppressed reclaim their art scene. She explores how far this process is driven by what locals call 'ekasi', the street-cool of the townships, and has a dance lesson from viral amapiano dance star Bontle Modiselle. She also gets a new tattoo at Soweto Ink, goes bike spinning on Soweto's streets and meets hair sculptor Lebohang Motaung, whose gravity-defying braiding is going mainstream

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A passion for mountain-biking turns perilous as a jump goes terribly wrong, and a family have a lucky escape when an ancient oak tree comes crashing into their home

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Properties in Sittingbourne in Kent, Ferryhill in Co Durham and Poplar in east London bought at property auctions are renovated by developers hoping to make a profit either by renting out or selling on. Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph ascertain whether any of the twists and turns experienced by their new owners along the way have damaged their chances of making any money

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: There is a seabird spectacle from South Stack on Anglesey. A location famed for its dark skies and cliff nesting birds, Gillian Burke explores why it's such a hotspot for wildlife. Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are on fledge watch at RSPB Arne in Dorset, as they are keen to see which of the nests successfully disembarks before the end of the series. And Megan McCubbin returns to RSPB Arne to explore some of its sensational seasonal characters

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the eighth day from the All England Club, featuring fourth-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles. Day eight was a productive one for American players last year, with Taylor Fritz and Amanda Anisimova winning in straight sets against Jason Kubler and Harmony Tan respectively, and Jack Sock and Coco Gauff reaching the semi-finals of the mixed doubles after a 6-3, 6-4 victory over Edouard Roger-Vasselin and Alize Cornet. Prior to that doubles match, Cornet had already tasted defeat once on the day when she lost to 4-6, 6-4, 6-3 to Ajla Tomljanovic

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present further live coverage of the eighth day from the All England Club, featuring fourth-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Keanu is stunned when Lisa returns with Peggy and Kim's family prepare for her release from prison. Jean tries to play matchmaker with Stacey and Theo and Kathy asks Bobby to infiltrate Rocky's stag night

programme.title: Your Body Uncovered with Kate Garraway
programme.desc: Kate and Dr Guddi meet Tina, whose adventurous lifestyle has ground to a halt because of a spine problem, and Annabelle, who was pregnant when she found out she had breast cancer. Tina has always been young at heart, leading an active life and enjoying adventurous activities with her daughter Kirsty. But in the last year, Tina noticed a tingling in her arm which worsened into intense pain. Annabelle was eight months pregnant with her third child when she found a lump in her breast, and she and husband Grant were shocked to find out it was an aggressive type of breast cancer

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the eighth day's play at the All England Club, featuring men's and ladies' matches in the fourth round. Nick Kyrgios, Simona Halep, Rafael Nadal and Elena Rybakina were among the victorious players on day eight in 2022

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Vic and Bob host another half-hour of the silly, outrageous and downright stupid, with the bald-headed Stott brothers appearing on This Is Your Life, and dodgy councillors Cox and Evans brightening up the seafront at Aldington-on-Sea with celebrity litter bins. Comedy first aired in 1995, starring Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer

programme.desc: John Craven and Margherita Taylor travel to the village of Charsfield in Suffolk to celebrate acclaimed rural writer Ronald Blythe, who died in January aged 100. They visit key locations of his work and explore traditional crafts. Margherita talks to nature writer Melissa Harrison, who was inspired to move to the region by Blythe's works, and John meets a proud Suffolk speaker who explains how the dialect evolved

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the last leg of his railway journey around the north-west coast of England, visiting the childhood home of William Wordsworth in Cockermouth, Cumbria, and ending in Maryport, where the Solway Firth marks the border between England and Scotland

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: As they compete for a place in the quarter final, Sara Pascoe takes the sewers back to the 1990s. In the Pattern Challenge, the competitors make the most popular trousers of the decade, cargo pants, before rustling up a '90s celebrity-themed fancy dress outfit in the Transformation Challenge. In the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers make dresses fit for a '90s supermodel

programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the contest from Hemswell in Lincolnshire. Experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey help guide the Red and Blue teams to a prime purchase in a bid to make the greater profit at auction. Caroline also hits the road to learn about the small bubble cars that were once very popular on British roads

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader travels around the country, immersing himself in Italian culture and sampling its renowned cuisine, beginning in the south-eastern region of Puglia. Clive discovers how the James Bond franchise helped turn an abandoned town into a world heritage site, finds out why Puglia is the gay holiday capital of Italy and learns to play in a traditional pizzica band

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of his youth, starting at Preston's Fulwood Barracks and heading to Bury Bolton Street Station in Greater Manchester

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest Super League matches, including Hull Kingston Rovers v Hull FC, Warrington Wolves v St Helens and Salford Red Devils v Leeds Rhinos

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, including the opening men's and ladies' quarter finals, as well as doubles contests. Cameron Norrie became the first British player to reach the semi-finals of this tournament since Andy Murray was crowned champion in 2016 when he eventually prevailed 3-6, 7-5, 2-6, 6-3, 7-5 against Belgium's David Goffin at this stage last year to set up a clash with Novak Djokovic. Over on Centre Court, Ons Jabeur of Tunisia also had to fight back to defeat Czech player Marie Bouzkova 3-6, 6-1, 6-1, and she will be hoping to still be in contention this time around after eventually finishing as runner-up to Elena Rybakina in 2022

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents further live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, as the singles quarter-finals continue and last-eight contests also take place in the men's and ladies' doubles

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the ninth day's play at the All England Club, as the men's and ladies' quarter-finals got under way. Novak Djokovic, Cameron Norrie, Ons Jabeur and Tatjana Maria all booked their semi-final places on day nine 12 months ago

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Couple Irene and Richard remodel their three-bedroom Croydon home, which has started to feel too small after living there for 19 years, with three teenagers fighting for space. Richard's biggest bugbear is being made to wait for hours to use the only bathroom in the house, while Irene is desperate for more space but is unwilling to get rid of her industrial sized tumble dryer, and architects Lizzie Fraher and Laura Jane Clark will have to incorporate a place for her prized possession into their design

programme.title: 3 Non-Blondes
programme.desc: Hidden-camera comedy show featuring the talents of Tameka Empson, Jocelyn Jee Esien and Ninia Benjamin, who take to the streets of Britain in guises ranging from tarts touting for Jesus to African performance poets. First broadcast in 2003

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: County Lines (2019)
programme.desc: A 14-year-old boy, bullied at school, is approached by a young man who appears to offer him protection. However, this is in fact the start of the youngster being groomed as a smuggler for the man's nationwide drug-selling enterprise. Drama, starring Harris Dickinson, Montserrat Roig de Puig and Marcus Rutherford

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How one cyclist uses social media to recover stolen bikes. Plus, how police are using body heat sensors to prevent robberies from trades people's vans

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An anonymous tip leads police to crack the UK's biggest case of food fraud. An officer's instinct uncovers a conspiracy to commit massive insurance fraud and a faulty break light leads to police arresting two high level drug dealers

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: After renting for many years in London, actress Jill Halfpenny and her 13-year-old son Harvey made the big decision to start a new life in the North East, where Jill was brought up. They both love the sea views of their new home in Tynemouth, but the flat's layout is revealing its glitches. The kitchen is right at the back of the property, making it feel dark and disconnected, the bathroom has no windows and the only outside space is a tiny balcony. Using virtual reality techniques, architects Will Foster and Lynsey Elliot compete to remodel the property

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fourth day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. England have won their last four Tests at this venue, including a one-wicket triumph over the Aussies in 2019

programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream from Shakespeare's Globe
programme.desc: Emma Rice's colourful production of Shakespeare's popular comedy, fusing music, dance and comedy. It's the story of four runaway lovers who find themselves in the forest outside of Athens, where they get caught up in a dispute between the king and queen of the fairies, just as a troupe of amateur actors is trying to rehearse a play. Between these two unlikely groups flies the michievous fairy Puck, armed with a wicked sense of humour and a love potion capable of making anyone fall in love with the first person they set eyes upon. Meow Meow and Ncuti Gatwa lead the cast

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: Andy Torbet and local seafaring volunteers build a boat made of just willow and cow hide, and set out to cross the dangerous Pentland Firth as the ancient Orcadians would have done. Neil Oliver investigates the extraordinary discovery of some human bones, Chris Packham goes in search of whales and Shini Somara uncovers the powers of the tides

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore examines the transformation of Vienna into a great cultural capital after the Ottoman threat receded at the end of the 17th century. The city, no longer an outpost defending the West from Islamic invaders, was rebuilt and the Habsburgs vowed their empire and imperial capital would become the most glittering in the world, a magnet for musicians including Mozart, Haydn and Beethoven

programme.title: Mark Gatiss on John Minton: The Lost Man of British Art
programme.desc: The League of Gentlemen star Mark Gatiss examines the life and career of largely forgotten English artist John Minton, who was one of the leading figures in post-war British art

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: The documentary exploring health care before the arrival of the NHS concludes, revealing how Victorian hospitals - often seen as a last resort for the destitute rather than a place of healing - transformed into the modern centres of medicine they have become today. Includes archive footage and first-hand accounts from patients, doctors and nurses from an era when infectious disease was virtually untreatable. Narrated by Robert Winston

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore examines the transformation of Vienna into a great cultural capital after the Ottoman threat receded at the end of the 17th century. The city, no longer an outpost defending the West from Islamic invaders, was rebuilt and the Habsburgs vowed their empire and imperial capital would become the most glittering in the world, a magnet for musicians including Mozart, Haydn and Beethoven

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fifth and final day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. There had not been a draw between the sides at this venue since 1975, with nine Tests having an outright winner here since, and England having a slight edge in that time with five wins

programme.title: Attenborough and the Sea Dragon
programme.desc: The naturalist joins a team of scientists examining the 200 million-year-old fossilised remains of an ichthyosaur, a vast sea creature which was discovered on Dorset's Jurassic Coast. As the skeleton is reassembled, advanced imaging technology and computer animation is used to create a simulation of the sea creature as it would have appeared when it was still alive - the most detailed reconstruction of its kind ever attempted. Meanwhile, forensic investigators painstakingly examine the bones to solve the mystery of how the ichthyosaur died

programme.title: The Day the Dinosaurs Died
programme.desc: Documentary examining whether an asteroid strike 66 million years ago triggered a worldwide catastrophe, killing off the dinosaurs and wiping out 75 per cent of all life on Earth. Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod joins a multimillion pound drilling expedition into the exact spot in the Gulf of Mexico that was the point of impact, while palaeopathologist Alice Roberts meets leading scientists to find if the effects could have wiped out dinosaurs across the world almost immediately

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team investigates the controversial world of alien communication, asking whether humans would communicate with them, or should communicate with them at all. Exoplaneteer George Dransfield travels to the Jodrell Bank Observatory to meet astrophysicist Professor Tim O'Brien, who explains how scientists around the world use radioastronomy to listen for extraterrestrial signals

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on the heavyweights of the dinosaur world, creatures that have only been unearthed in recent years. The 125ft-long Argentinosaurus, which roamed South America 95 million years ago, was the creature that eclipsed all others - and remains the largest dinosaur ever discovered. For years, these colossal plant-eaters were considered immune to attack from any predator - until the discovery of new giant killer the mapusaurus, whose fate was inextricably linked to the Argentinosaurus

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary concludes by focusing on dinosaurs' extraordinary ability to adapt to their surroundings, including the nothronychus, a carnivore that gave up eating meat to survive. The film also reveals how, despite their success as hunters or foragers, the creatures fell victim to the deadly illness botulism, and suggests their ultimate downfall came about when a nine-mile-wide asteroid smashed into the Earth, triggering a cataclysmic chain of events that wiped out 60 per cent of all species on the planet

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: How the plant-eating leaellynasaura coped with conditions in the Antarctic at a time when the continent was covered in trees and existed for half the year in warm sunshine and the other in freezing twilight. The extreme variations in temperature brought about an epic struggle for survival as creatures strove to keep one step ahead of their polar predators

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: It is 65 million years ago and time is fast running out for the dinosaurs. As the Cretaceous period draws to a close and massive volcanic activity poisons the air, an enormous comet is the harbinger of doom for the huge creatures and augurs a new chapter in Earth's natural history

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: Andy Torbet and local seafaring volunteers build a boat made of just willow and cow hide, and set out to cross the dangerous Pentland Firth as the ancient Orcadians would have done. Neil Oliver investigates the extraordinary discovery of some human bones, Chris Packham goes in search of whales and Shini Somara uncovers the powers of the tides

programme.title: Attenborough and the Sea Dragon
programme.desc: The naturalist joins a team of scientists examining the 200 million-year-old fossilised remains of an ichthyosaur, a vast sea creature which was discovered on Dorset's Jurassic Coast. As the skeleton is reassembled, advanced imaging technology and computer animation is used to create a simulation of the sea creature as it would have appeared when it was still alive - the most detailed reconstruction of its kind ever attempted. Meanwhile, forensic investigators painstakingly examine the bones to solve the mystery of how the ichthyosaur died

programme.title: The Day the Dinosaurs Died
programme.desc: Documentary examining whether an asteroid strike 66 million years ago triggered a worldwide catastrophe, killing off the dinosaurs and wiping out 75 per cent of all life on Earth. Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod joins a multimillion pound drilling expedition into the exact spot in the Gulf of Mexico that was the point of impact, while palaeopathologist Alice Roberts meets leading scientists to find if the effects could have wiped out dinosaurs across the world almost immediately

programme.title: Steam Days
programme.desc: Miles Kington looks at freight trains - the workhorses of Britain's railways - and the pattern of their usage before motorways. He examines the role of the British Rail Standard Class 9F steam locomotive, one of the most powerful to run on British railways, and hitches a lift in the cab of 92203 Black Prince. First shown in 1986

programme.title: Gyles Brandreth Remembers...Hinge & Bracket
programme.desc: Gyles Brandreth remembers the work of the comedy and musical duo

programme.title: Dear Ladies

programme.title: Babs
programme.desc: Biopic of Barbara Windsor, following the key events of the actress's life over the course of 50 years. The story begins in 1993, with the actress preparing for a stage performance shortly before joining the cast of EastEnders. She looks back to her childhood as a lonely evacuee in the Second World War, her rise to fame in the Carry On films and her difficult relationships with her father and her first husband, gangster Ronnie Knight. Samantha Spiro, Jaime Winstone, Honor Kneafsey and Windsor herself share the lead role

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A look back at the iconic hairdos people in Britain have flirted with over the past 60 years. From the meringue-like confections of Raymond 'Teasy Weasy', via the geometric bob cuts of Vidal Sassoon, to the big-hair heyday of bouffants and beehives - not forgetting the mullet and the 1970s perms. Part of the Timeshift documentary strand

programme.title: Origins of Us
programme.desc: Anatomist and anthropologist Alice Roberts reveals the story of human evolution as told through the body, revealing that the way people think, look and behave is a product of the six-million-year journey that took man from forest-dwelling apes to the most successful species on the planet. She begins with the skeleton, revealing how the evolutionary journey of man's ancestors has affected everything from the way a person walks and runs to the back pain they suffer, their narrow waist and the shape of their bottom

programme.title: Steam Days
programme.desc: Miles Kington looks at freight trains - the workhorses of Britain's railways - and the pattern of their usage before motorways. He examines the role of the British Rail Standard Class 9F steam locomotive, one of the most powerful to run on British railways, and hitches a lift in the cab of 92203 Black Prince. First shown in 1986

programme.desc: Join Maddie on a journey of discovery to find out about plants around the world. Find out how we can help to look after them and our planet, and why and how they grow and survive in different climates. Maddie explores plants in the rainforest, big and small, and sees how the clever drip-tip leaves work watering the plants beneath them. We’ll see how plants in hot, dry parts of world like the desert thrive in their own special ways, like the cactus plant that stores litres of water in its waxy leaves. And we’ll learn how plants that grow close to home in the UK, can grow in a colder and wetter climate.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle tries to be a purr-fect house guest for Mrs Hobbs but he misses the Brooklyn-Bells

programme.title: Andy's Aquatic Adventures
programme.desc: Mr Hammond is on a wildlife trip in New Zealand, and Andy is eager to hear what animals he has spotted

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say ‘cucumber’, and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see cucumbers that are crunchy, mushy in the middle and curly. Dee meets a cool cucumber, and we meet a very cute baby one. The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dee’s friend finally succeeds in saying today’s word!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The letters try to sing the alphabet song, and although it takes a few tries for them to get it right, they have a lot of fun

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Pug makes a kite, but he doesn’t know how to fly it. He and Dog go to China and meet two squabbling Pandas looking for bamboo shoots. Pug and his kite get blown up in the air, and he lands in a bamboo forest. The Pandas then help him with his kite.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee strokes Enid the cat - prompting the squirrels to seek animals they can stroke as well

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Bad Idea Puppy mishears that Take My Time Tortoise is moving

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Imaginative Purple arrives in Colourland. Learn about the colour purple with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends are at a racetrack, where they have lots of fun with different types of bicycles. Meanwhile, the Tumbles are getting ready for the Great Golden Egg Race.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Po have their favourite toys to play with, but Laa-Laa doesn't have her ball, so the others help find it. They also watch a Tummy Tale about a boy and his favourite thing - a bike

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea and Supertato get stuck inside a giant bubble

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Greedy Grandmaster Glitch has been gorging on chocolate and wants more. The Grimbots discover a place called Chocolate Hills on Bohol Island in the Philippines and take him there

programme.title: Apple Tree House
programme.desc: David feels left out when Sam and Bella go on a trip with their dance class so Kobi asks David to help out with his jobs on the estate

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Gem and her teams of Swashbucklers try to win her jewels back from pirates Cook, Line and Sinker. Game show for children

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee introduces the squirrels to Bucky, his old rocking horse - but first it needs to be repaired

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter takes one of Old Brown's tail feathers, and a wild chase across the valley ensues to retrieve it and pacify the furious owl

programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Whilst practicing magic tricks, Fred finds a chisel that leads him and Pete on an adventure to a quarry and to the Minack - an amazing theatre built into the rocks on a clifftop

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Captain Barnacles and his niece and nephew, Ursa and Orson, must rescue walrus pups who are stranded on a runaway ice floe, before it collides with a huge iceberg

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The Heelers remember their favourite things!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Tomato paints himself green and goes undercover as a Mini Pea to discover how Evil Pea is firing them at Tato Tower. He makes an unexpected new Mini Pea friend

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch's feather-collecting mission goes wrong

programme.title: Topsy and Tim
programme.desc: The twins have a party to celebrate their fifth birthdays, and mummy and daddy buy them the best present ever

programme.title: Dipdap
programme.desc: The Line draws a vase, but it gets smashed

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: When Gramps comes to babysit, he brings Trevor and Violet along too. During a game of hide-and-sing the dogs hide next door, causing confusion and chaos for poor Mrs Hobbs

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Duck has been leaving his toys everywhere, so Sarah decides to help him tidy his bedroom

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo has a sleepover at Gran Gran's, but bedtime comes while it's still light outside.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Mother Clanger closes her garden to visitors to get a bit of peace. She never imagined the problems this would cause for the Soup Dragon and for Major Clanger

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos build an arch out of their bricks, while the children make one out of stones

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, featuring fourth-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles. There were mixed fortunes for British players on day seven last year, as Heather Watson lost 6-2, 6-4 to Germany's Jule Niemeier, but Cameron Norrie's excellent run continued when he prevailed in straight sets against America's Tommy Paul. Also on this day, Carlos Alcaraz's tournament came to an end when the Spaniard lost to Jannik Sinner of Italy in four sets

programme.desc: Further live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles. programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the conclusion of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes. The guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Match of the Day Wales Live
programme.desc: USA Women v Wales Women (Kick-off 9.00pm). Catrin Heledd presents coverage of the friendly at PayPal Park in San Jose. The Americans are fine-tuning their preparations for the World Cup, as they look to triumph in the competition for the third successive time. This is sure to be a tough test for Gemma Graingers side, but they go into this match unbeaten in their last six matches since an agonising extra-time loss to Switzerland in the World Cup play-offs. With analysis from Nia Jones and Katie Sherwood

programme.title: Talk Disability: Invisible Disabilities
programme.desc: Welsh Paralympian Olivia Breen discusses her life and bouncing back from setbacks to become a multiple Paralympic and World Champion in sprint and long jump. From her very first sports day when she was five, Olivia knew running was for her, and never gave up on her dream. We hear from Olivia on the highs and lows of becoming a multiple Paralympic and World Champion

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.desc: Live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, featuring the opening men's and ladies's quarter finals. programme.title: Brave Britain with Fergal Keane

programme.title: Joe Swash: Teens in Care
programme.desc: Joe Swash reveals the harsh reality of what it's like growing up in the care system, spending time with teenagers who are all at crucial stages of their life. Joe's mum Kiffy has been a foster carer for over 15 years and he wants to spend time with teens across the UK who live in foster care, in residential children's homes, and some who have left at 18 and are trying to make it alone, to show what growing up as a teenager in care is really like

programme.title: Ruck Stars
programme.desc: Documentary following the rising stars of the Under 18 academies of two of the biggest teams in world rugby, the Scarlets and the Ospreys, as they chase the dream of going pro. Fullback Cori returns after a foot injury that could have derailed his career. Talented centre Dafydd looks to make his mark. Macs is feeling the pressure of being one of the players already on contract

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Journalist Hazel Martin investigates the death of Annie Borjesson, a Swedish woman who was found dead on Prestwick Beach. Within hours of her body being found her family were told it was suicide, but they believe the evidence points to murder

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith are in Spalding, South Lincolnshire - the historic hub of Britain's bulb and flower farming industry, to explore its rich heritage. The pair discover how the the current generation of farmers are shaping the future of the flower industry and find out about the economic changes growers have faced. Charlotte meets James Lacey who explains how sunflowers are produced, picked and packed at his family farm and his love of high-tech harvesting. Joe joins young grower Hannah Benson as she delivers hand-cut blooms to sell at the UK's oldest flower auction. Tom Heap reveals how a study using flower chemicals in feed could reduce livestock methane emissions, and Adam Henson discovers how planting trees within arable fields can revolutionise a small farm's income

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Newby Hall & Gardens in Ripon, North Yorkshire. Treasures include an intriguing letter from Lord Nelson, politely replying to his optician just weeks before the Battle of Trafalgar. There's also a piece of the set from Live Aid in 1985, rescued from a skip, and an engagement ring picked up in a pawn shop. The Bradford Museum also launches an appeal to find the families related to the thousands of people in photos in their archive

programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton discuss Government policy towards refugees and the place of bishops in the House of Lords. Plus, the story of a woman with young-onset dementia

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Katherine Jenkins joins celebrations at Arundel's Roman Catholic cathedral for the Feast of Corpus Christi. The festivities include a spectacular carpet of flowers and a procession from the cathedral to the castle. With music that celebrates the Eucharist and an a capella performance from vocal harmony group Stellina at Blenheim Palace

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, featuring fourth-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles. There were mixed fortunes for British players on day seven last year, as Heather Watson lost 6-2, 6-4 to Germany's Jule Niemeier, but Cameron Norrie's excellent run continued when he prevailed in straight sets against America's Tommy Paul. Also on this day, Carlos Alcaraz's tournament came to an end when the Spaniard lost to Jannik Sinner of Italy in four sets

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles. Novak Djokovic's recent dominance of the event continued at this stage last year when he dropped a set to wildcard Tim van Rijthoven but was otherwise very comfortable in a 6-2, 4-6, 6-1, 6-2 victory

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith are in Spalding, South Lincolnshire - the historic hub of Britain's bulb and flower farming industry, to explore its rich heritage. The pair discover how the the current generation of farmers are shaping the future of the flower industry and find out about the economic changes growers have faced. Charlotte meets James Lacey who explains how sunflowers are produced, picked and packed at his family farm and his love of high-tech harvesting. Joe joins young grower Hannah Benson as she delivers hand-cut blooms to sell at the UK's oldest flower auction. Tom Heap reveals how a study using flower chemicals in feed could reduce livestock methane emissions, and Adam Henson discovers how planting trees within arable fields can revolutionise a small farm's income

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Newby Hall & Gardens in Ripon, North Yorkshire. Treasures include an intriguing letter from Lord Nelson, politely replying to his optician just weeks before the Battle of Trafalgar. There's also a piece of the set from Live Aid in 1985, rescued from a skip, and an engagement ring picked up in a pawn shop. The Bradford Museum also launches an appeal to find the families related to the thousands of people in photos in their archive

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the eighth day from the All England Club, featuring fourth-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles. Eventual champion Elena Rybakina prevailed 7-5, 6-3 against Petra Martic at this stage last year, while on Centre Court another 2022 finalist in Nick Kyrgios had to work somewhat harder to overcome Brandon Nakashima in five sets. There was another match that went to a deciding set on the No. 2 Court, with Cristian Garin eventually getting the better of Alex De Minaur

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the eighth day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round singles matches are scheduled to conclude in the men's and ladies' singles. Two former champions won in straight sets on Centre Court at this stage last year, with Simona Halep comfortably prevailing 6-1, 6-2 against fourth seed Paula Badosa, before Rafael Nadal won 6-4, 6-2, 7-6 against Botic van de Zandschulp

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Bangor in Co Down to help Mandy McCreight, who is isolated in her bedroom due to a variety of medical issues and is missing out on family life. Her children Ben and Kara also have mobility problems, while husband Davey looks after everyone, but now he is suffering from a back injury. The entire family are under real stress and the house is not wheelchair friendly, making the situation unbearable

programme.title: Murder in the Badlands
programme.desc: The inside story of 15-year-old Arlene Arkinson, who disappeared in 1994. Arlene left a housing estate in Castlederg to attend a disco in Bundoran. Her older sister Kathleen waved her goodbye but would never see her again. Her remains are undiscovered but presumed to have been buried in one of the vast swathes of bogland or forestry on the Irish Border

programme.title: Community Life
programme.desc: Vinny Hurrell presents an appeal on behalf of Womens' Aid Armagh Down, highlighting the work of the charity providing specialised support for 40 years to victims of domestic abuse. Vinny meets one of the women helped by the charity and some of those who manage it to get an understanding of the important service they offer in times of real crisis

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Freddy and Baba flee the city in search of an isolated spot to bury the witness to their murderous night in the woods. programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the ninth day from the All England Club, featuring the opening men's and ladies's quarter finals. There was nearly an upset on Centre Court at this stage last year, when reigning champion Novak Djokovic lost the opening two sets of his match against Italy's Jannik Sinner, but the Serbian eventually discovered his best form and bounced back to prevail 5-7, 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-2. Meanwhile, Tatjana Maria defeated German compatriot Jule Niemeier 4-6, 6-2, 7-5 on the No. 1 Court

programme.title: Brave Britain with Fergal Keane
programme.desc: Award-winning reporter Fergal Keane goes in search of hope in today's Britain, turning to those in hard-pressed communities and hearing stories of everyday courage. From Glasgow shipyard workers to Leeds council estate residents to tenant farmers in Cornwall, Fergal shines light on the unheard voices of courage across the country

programme.title: Joe Swash: Teens in Care
programme.desc: Joe Swash reveals the harsh reality of what it's like growing up in the care system, spending time with teenagers who are all at crucial stages of their life. Joe's mum Kiffy has been a foster carer for over 15 years and he wants to spend time with teens across the UK who live in foster care, in residential children's homes, and some who have left at 18 and are trying to make it alone, to show what growing up as a teenager in care is really like

programme.desc: A look at how after decades of violence a breakthrough was reached in the form of the Good Friday Agreement in 1998, after years of talks at government level and with the intervention of US president Bill Clinton.
